definition: to decorate/to embellish/to repair/to build/to write/to cultivate/to study/to take (a class)

sentences.english: The road works caused much complaint among local neighbors.
sentences.chinese: 修路工程使當地居民叫苦連天。

sentences.english: In 2006, the grown-up Lan Jinfeng decided to build a road.
sentences.chinese: 年，成長後的藍錦鋒決定帶着村裏人修路。

sentences.english: The road-works caused much complaint among local neighbours.
sentences.chinese: 修路工程使當地居民叫苦連天。

sentences.english: A prisoner picked up 1,000yuan in the course of building the road outside the prison.
sentences.chinese: 一個勞改犯人在監獄外修路的時候撿到1000元。

sentences.english: They build roads, houses, bridges, ships, pipelines, and canals.
sentences.chinese: 他們修路，蓋房，架橋，造船，鋪管道，挖運河。

sentences.english: Burch, a parish leader, pleading with his colleagues for road spending.
sentences.chinese: Burch這樣勸說他的同事花錢修路。

sentences.english: He is a highly skilled road mender.
sentences.chinese: 他是一個技術高超的修路工。

sentences.english: He donated money to have roads made and bridges built so people could get around more easily.
sentences.chinese: 於是他捐錢造橋修路，方便百姓。

sentences.english: Returned the road - mender , so you don't know that the road is under repair?
sentences.chinese: 那路工接着說，您不知道我們正在修路嗎？

sentences.english: They built roads, maintained some communication.
The bulldozers grade the land before the road is built.
sentences.chinese: 在修路前，推土機先平整土地。

sentences.english: They leveled all the old trees to make way for the road.
sentences.chinese: 他們把老樹全部砍倒，騰出地方修路。

sentences.english: The road builders suffer high stress and loneliness.
sentences.chinese: 修路士兵忍受着高壓和孤獨。

sentences.english: When the feet entering the campus, I almost forgot the noisy road outside the school.
sentences.chinese: 當雙腳踏進這個校園，我幾乎忘了校門外修路的喧囂。

sentences.english: I talk to my friend and someone repairing the road behind us starts up a jackhammer .
sentences.chinese: 我和朋友說話，而某人在我們身後正用手提鑽在修路。

sentences.english: We are the beginning of 7 to build roads, has built more than 2 months.
sentences.chinese: 我們7月初開始前來修路，至今已修了2個多月。

definition: to bridge/to put up a bridge
to provide work to relieve poverty
to dig out/to excavate/to scoop out
to repair (sth broken)/to restore (sth damaged)/to establish friendly relations with/(literary) to do meritorious deeds
to demolish a building and relocate the inhabitants
to repair/to refurbish/to renovate/to refit/to mend/to rebuild
